BakePanel.label: BakePanel.start_1
Bake: To get started, press 'Autodetect All' above.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.start_2
Bake: Then if the settings look right, press 'Copy and Bake'.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.panel_render_error
Bake: ERROR! Panel is unable to render!

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.feature_set_unavailable
Bake: This feature set is unavaliable with the current platform selection.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.bakepasses.desc
Bake: The different PBR effects to generate from the source material.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.generaloptions.desc
Bake: General options that apply to all platforms regardless of target.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_resolution.desc
Bake:
Output resolution for the textures.
- 2048 is typical for desktop use.
- 1024 is reccomended for the Quest
베이크(Bake):
테스쳐들의 결과 해상도.
- 2048 데스크탑 용
- 1024 퀘스트 용

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_use_decimation.desc
Bake: Reduce polycount before baking, then use Normal maps to restore detail
베이크(Bake): 베이킹하기 전에 폴리 카운트를 줄인 다음 노멀 맵을 사용하여 디테일을 복원합니다.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_generate_uvmap.desc
Bake:
Re-pack islands for your mesh to a new non-overlapping UVMap.
Only disable if your UVs are non-overlapping already.
This will leave any map named "Detail Map" alone.
Uses UVPackMaster where available for more efficient UVs, make sure the window is showing

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_uv_overlap_correction.desc
Bake: Method used to prevent overlaps in UVMap

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_prioritize_face.desc
Bake: Scale any UV islands attached to the head/eyes by a given factor.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_face_scale.desc
Bake: How much to scale up the face/eyes portion of the textures.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_quick_compare.desc
Bake: Move output avatar next to existing one to quickly compare

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_illuminate_eyes.desc
Bake:
Relight LeftEye and RightEye to be full brightness.
Without this, the eyes will have the shadow of the surrounding socket baked in,
which doesn't animate well

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_smoothness.desc
Bake:
Bakes Roughness and then inverts the values.
To use this, it needs to be packed to the Alpha channel of either Diffuse or Metallic.
Not neccesary if your mesh has a global roughness value

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_diffuse.desc
Bake:
Bakes diffuse, un-lighted color. Usually you will want this.
While baking, this temporarily links "Metallic" to "Anisotropic Rotation" as metallic can cause issues.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_preserve_seams.desc
Bake:
Forces the Decimate operation to preserve vertices making up seams, preventing hard edges along seams.
May result in less ideal geometry.
Use if you notice ugly edges along your texture seams.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_normal.desc
Bake:
Bakes a normal (bump) map. Allows you to keep the shading of a complex object with
the geometry of a simple object. If you have selected 'Decimate', it will create a map
that makes the low res output look like the high res input.
Will not work well if you have self-intersecting islands

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_ao.desc
Bake:
Bakes Ambient Occlusion, non-projected shadows. Adds a significant amount of detail to your model.
Reccomended for non-toon style avatars.
Takes a fairly long time to bake

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_displacement.desc
Bake:
Bakes a normalized Displacement map, according to the material displacement in Blender.
Can add real 3d surface detail to models.
Results are in Linear space, so make sure uncheck Color Texture in Unity.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_questdiffuse.desc
Bake: Blends the result of the Diffuse and AO bakes to make Quest-compatible shading.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_diffuse_alpha_pack.desc
Bake: What to pack to the Diffuse Alpha channel

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_metallic_alpha_pack.desc
Bake: What to pack to the Metallic Alpha channel

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_alpha.desc
Bake:
Bakes transparency by connecting the last Principled BSDF Alpha input
to the Base Color input and baking Diffuse.
Not a native pass in Blender, results may vary
Unused if you are baking to Quest

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_pass_metallic.desc
Bake:
Bakes metallic by connecting the last Principled BSDF Metallic input
to the Base Color input and baking Diffuse.
Not a native pass in Blender, results may vary

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_questdiffuse_opacity.desc
Bake:
The opacity of the shadows to blend onto the Diffuse map.
This should match the unity slider for AO on the Desktop version.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_uv_overlap_correction.none.desc
Bake: Leave islands as they are. Use if islands don't self-intersect at all

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_uv_overlap_correction.unmirror.desc
Bake: Move all face islands with positive X values over one to un-pin mirrored UVs. Solves most UV pinning issues.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_uv_overlap_correction.reproject.desc
Bake: Use blender's Smart UV Project to come up with an entirely new island layout. Tends to reduce quality.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_diffuse_alpha_pack.smoothness.desc
Bake: Pack Smoothness. Most efficient if you don't have transparency or metallic textures.

BakePanel.label: Scene.bake_metallic_alpha_pack.smoothness.desc
Bake: Pack Smoothness. Use this if your Diffuse alpha channel is already populated with Transparency

BakePanel.label: Scene.draft_quality_desc
Bake: Reduce the number of samples and cap resolution at 1024, speeds up iteration

BakePanel.label: Tools.twist_tutorial.desc
Bake: This will open a basic tutorial on how to setup and use these constraints. You can skip to the Unity section.

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.warn_missing_nodes
Bake: A material in use isn't using Nodes, fix this in the Shading tab.

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.preset_desktop.desc
Bake:
Preset for producing an Excellent-rated Desktop avatar, not accounting for bones.
This will try to automatically detect which bake passes are relevant to your model

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.preset_quest.desc
Bake:
Preset for producing an Excellent-rated Quest avatar, not accounting for bones.
This will try to automatically detect which bake passes are relevant to your model

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.bake.desc
Bake:
Perform the bake. Warning, this performs an actual render!
This will create a copy of your avatar to leave the original alone.
Depending on your machine and model, this could take an hour or more.
For each pass, any Value node in your materials labeled bake_<bakename> will be
set to 1.0, for more granular customization.

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.error.render_engine
Bake: You need to set your render engine to Cycles first!

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.error.render_disabled
Bake: One or more of your armature's meshes have rendering disabled!

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.info.success
Bake: Success! Textures and model saved to 'CATS Bake' folder next to your .blend file.

BakePanel.label: tuxedo_bake.tutorial_button.desc
Bake: This will open the Cats wiki page for the Bake panel

BakePanel.label: bake_the_effect_of_emission_on_nearby_surfaces_results_in_much_more_realistic_lighting_effects_but_can_animate_less_well
Bake: Bake the effect of emission on nearby surfaces. Results in much more realistic lighting effects, but can animate less well.

BakePanel.label: bakes_the_effect_of_any_eye_glow_onto_surrounding_objects_but_not_viceversa_improves_animation_when_eyes_are_moving_around
Bake: Bakes the effect of any eye glow onto surrounding objects, but not vice-versa. Improves animation when eyes are moving around..

BakePanel.label: blends_emission_into_the_diffuse_map_for_engines_without_a_seperate_emission_map
Bake: Blends emission into the diffuse map, for engines without a seperate emission map

BakePanel.label: convert_diffuse_and_metallic_to_premultiplied_diffuse_and_specular_compatible_with_older_engines
Bake: Convert Diffuse and Metallic to premultiplied Diffuse and Specular. Compatible with older engines

BakePanel.label: denoise_the_resulting_image_after_emitao_reccomended_as_this_will_reduce_the_grainy_quality_of_inexpensive_rendering
Bake: Denoise the resulting image after emit/AO. Reccomended as this will reduce the 'grainy' quality of inexpensive rendering..

BakePanel.label: device_to_bake_on_gpu_gives_a_significant_speedup_but_can_cause_issues_depending_on_your_graphics_drivers
Bake: Device to bake on. GPU gives a significant speedup, but can cause issues depending on your graphics drivers.

BakePanel.label: experimental_try_to_keep_uvps_lock_overlapping_enabled
Bake: Experimental. Try to keep UVP's lock overlapping enabled

BakePanel.label: for_source_engine_only_provides_diffuse_lighting_reflections_for_nonmetallic_objects
Bake: For Source engine only. Provides diffuse lighting reflections for nonmetallic objects.

BakePanel.label: generate_an_additional_lod_used_for_simplified_physics_interactions
Bake: Generate an additional LOD used for simplified physics interactions

BakePanel.label: generate_courser_decimation_levels_for_efficient_rendering
Bake: Generate courser decimation levels for efficient rendering.

BakePanel.label: generate_the_twistbones_on_the_upper_half_of_the_bone_usually_used_for_upper_legs
Bake: Generate the twistbones on the upper half of the bone. Usually used for upper legs.

BakePanel.label: ignore_currently_hidden_objects_when_copying
Bake: Ignore currently hidden objects when copying

BakePanel.label: image_type_to_use_when_exporting
Bake: image type to use when exporting

BakePanel.label: lod_generation_levels_as_a_percent_of_the_max_tris
Bake: LOD generation levels, as a percent of the max tris

BakePanel.label: maximum_bones_a_prop_can_be_attached_to_to_be_considered_a_prop_more_will_create_more_toggleable_props_but_increase_armature_complexity
Bake: Maximum bones a prop can be attached to to be considered a prop. More will create more toggleable props, but increase armature complexity.

BakePanel.label: merge_any_bone_with_twist_in_the_name_useful_as_quest_does_not_support_constraints
Bake: Merge any bone with 'Twist' in the name. Useful as Quest does not support constraints.

BakePanel.label: merges_smoothness_into_the_specular_map_for_engines_without_a_seperate_smoothness_map
Bake: Merges smoothness into the specular map, for engines without a seperate smoothness map

BakePanel.label: model_format_to_use_when_exporting
Bake: Model format to use when exporting

BakePanel.label: optimizes_solid_materials_by_making_a_small_area_for_them_ao_pass_will_nullify
Bake: Optimizes solid materials by making a small area for them. AO pass will nullify

BakePanel.label: pack_ambient_occlusion_to_the_green_channel_saves_a_texture_as_unity_uses_g_for_ao_r_for_metallic
Bake: Pack Ambient Occlusion to the Green channel. Saves a texture as Unity uses G for AO, R for Metallic.

BakePanel.label: rebake_to_vertex_colors_after_initial_bake_avoids_an_entire_extra_texture_if_your_colors_are_simple_enough_incorperates_ao
Bake: Rebake to vertex colors after initial bake. Avoids an entire extra texture, if your colors are simple enough. Incorperates AO.

BakePanel.label: remove_backup_shapekeys_in_the_final_result_eg_key__reverted_or_blinkold
Bake: Remove backup shapekeys in the final result, e.g. 'Key1 - Reverted' or 'blink_old'

BakePanel.label: select_this_to_keep_the_bones_after_merging_them_to_their_parents_or_to_the_active_bone
Bake: Select this to keep the bones after merging them to their parents or to the active bone

BakePanel.label: select_this_to_only_merge_the_weights_of_the_visible_meshes
Bake: Select this to only merge the weights of the visible meshes

BakePanel.label: seperate_vertices_unaffected_by_shape_keys_into_their_own_mesh_this_adds_a_drawcall_but_comes_with_a_significant_gpu_cost_savings_especially_on_mobile
Bake: Seperate vertices unaffected by shape keys into their own mesh. This adds a drawcall, but comes with a significant GPU cost savings, especially on mobile.

BakePanel.label: sharpen_resampled_images_after_baking_diffusesmoothnessmetallic_reccomended_as_any_sampling_will_cause_blur
Bake: Sharpen resampled images after baking diffuse/smoothness/metallic. Reccomended as any sampling will cause blur.

BakePanel.label: source_engine_uses_an_inverse_green_channel_this_fixes_that_on_export
Bake: Source engine uses an inverse green channel, this fixes that on export

BakePanel.label: target_another_bone_naming_standard_when_exporting_requires_standard_bone_names
Bake: Target another bone naming standard when exporting. Requires standard bone names

BakePanel.label: the_angle_reproject_uses_when_unwrapping_larger_angles_yield_less_islands_but_more_stretching_and_smaller_does_opposite
Bake: The angle Reproject uses when unwrapping. Larger angles yield less islands but more stretching and smaller does opposite

BakePanel.label: this_option_will_detect_any_meshes_weighted_to_a_single_bone_and_create_a_prop_bone_you_can_independently_scale_to_
Bake: This option will detect any meshes weighted to a single bone and create a 'prop' bone you can independently scale to 0.

BakePanel.label: what_to_pack_to_the_alpha_channel_of_specularity
Bake: What to pack to the Alpha channel of Specularity
When selected, currently active shape keys will be applied to the basis. This is extremely beneficial to performance if your avatar is intended to 'default' to one shapekey

BakePanel.label: mix
Bake: as having active shapekeys all the time is expensive. Keys ending in '_bake' are always applied to the basis and removed completely, regardless of this option.

BakePanel.label: while_not_technically_accurate_this_avoids_the_shine_effect_on_obscured_portions_of_your_model
Bake: While not technically accurate, this avoids the 'shine effect' on obscured portions of your model

BakePanel.label: will_show_extra_options_related_to_applicable_bones_and_texture_packing_setups
Bake: Will show extra options related to applicable bones and texture packing setups.

BakePanel.label: will_show_extra_options_related_to_which_bake_passes_are_performed_and_how
Bake: Will show extra options related to which bake passes are performed and how.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.nosource_1
Bake: To use Tuxedo Source features, you must use the BlenderSourceTools addon.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.nosource_1
Bake: The currently running script may also have hit a critical error.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.nosource_1
Bake: Performing an undo is highly suggested.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.open_gpu_settings
Bake: Open GPU Settings (Top of the page)

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.warn_using_cpu
Bake: No render device configured in Blender settings. Bake will use CPU

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.prop_handling.desc
Bake: What to do with objects marked as Props

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.prop_handling.none.desc
Bake: Treat as ordinary objects and bake in

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.prop_handling.generate.desc
Bake: Generate prop bones and animations for toggling

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.prop_handling.remove.desc
Bake: Remove completely, for platforms with no animation support

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.manual.desc
Bake: Bake will take island information from any UVMap named 'Target' from your meshes, else it will default to the render-active one. Decimation works better when there's only one giant island per loose mesh!

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.manual_no_pack.desc
Bake: Bake will take island information from any UVMap named 'Target' from your meshes. This will not move them so when all meshes are selected with the uv map active they cannot overlap. If there is no 'Target' map it will default to the render-active one. Decimation works better when there's only one giant island per loose mesh!

BakePanel.label: Tools.attach_clothes_err1_1
Bake: An already rigged body and other meshes required!

BakePanel.label: Tools.attach_clothes_err1_2
Bake: Make sure the body is the one highlighted.

BakePanel.label: Tools.attach_clothes_err1_3
Bake: Works with any mesh that conforms closely to the body.

BakePanel.label: Tools.anim_weight_incl_shapekeys.desc
Bake: Factor shapekeys into animation weighting. Disable if your model has large body shapekeys.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.garrys_mod_detect.desc
Bake: Preset for generating a garrys mod character, and even auto installing the addon.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.second_life_detect.desc
Bake: Preset for producing a single-material Second Life Mesh avatar

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.all_detect.desc
Bake: Attempt to bake all possible output platforms. Not significantly slower than baking for any one platform

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.add_copyonly.desc
Bake: Only copy the selected meshes, make no attempt to bake them.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.remove_copyonly.desc
Bake: Default behavior, bake in if visible

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.add_prop.desc
Bake: Generate ~Prop bones and enable/disable animations for the selected meshes.

BakePanel.label: BakePanel.remove_prop.desc
Bake: Disables prop bone generation for the selected meshes.

BakePanel.label: Bake.debug_bad_object
Bake: For Tuxedo bake: you should CTRL+Z

BakePanel.label: Bake.error_save_file
Bake: You need to save your .blend somewhere first!

BakePanel.label: Tools.fit_clothes.desc
Bake: Auto-rig all selected clothes to the active body. Should have next to no clipping, but its a good idea to delete internal geometry anyway

BakePanel.label: Tools.repair_shapekeys.desc
Bake: Attempt to repair messed up shapekeys caused by some Blender operations

BakePanel.label: Tools.smart_decimate.desc
Bake: Decimate all meshes attached to the selected armature, preserving shapekeys.

BakePanel.label: SmartDecimation.decimated_some_meshes
Bake: Decimated some meshes that went over the individual mesh polygon limit of

BakePanel.label: Tools.gen_twist_bones.desc
Bake: Attempt to generate twistbones for the selected bones

BakePanel.label: Tools.convert_to_secondlife.desc
Bake: Converts all main bone names to second life.\nMake sure your model has the standard bone names from after using Fix Model

BakePanel.label: Tools.convert_bones.fail
Bake: Failed to translate {translate_bone_fails} bones! They will be merged to their parent bones.

BakePanel.label: Tools.convert_to_valve.desc
Bake: Converts all main bone names to default valve bone names. \nMake sure your model has the standard bone names from after using Fix Model

BakePanel.label: Tools.export_gmod_addon.desc
Bake: Compile and export as Gmod playermodel addon to your addons. May not always work.

BakePanel.label: FT.select_shapes_1
Bake: Select shape keys to create FT shape keys.

BakePanel.label: FT.select_shapes_2
Bake: Specifying above will attempt to create them for you.

BakePanel.label: FT.select_shapes_3
Bake: Currently requires rotation to be applied.

BakePanel.label: FT.mesh_missing
Bake: Select the mesh with face shape keys.

BakePanel.label: Scene.decimation_remove_doubles.desc
Bake: Uncheck this if you get issues with this checked
焼く: Uncheck this if you got issues with with this checked

BakePanel.label: DecimationPanel.preset.excellent.description
Bake: The maximum number of tris you can have for an Excellent rating.
焼く: 優れた評価を得るために持つことができるトリスの最大数
베이크(Bake): 당신의 아바타가 Excellent 등급을 받을 수 있는 최대 삼각폴리곤(Tris) 개수입니다.

BakePanel.label: DecimationPanel.preset.good.description
Bake: The maximum number of tris you can have for a Good rating.
焼く: あなたが良い評価のために持つことができるトリスの最大数
베이크(Bake): 당신의 아바타가 Good 등급을 받을 수 있는 최대 삼각폴리곤(Tris) 개수입니다.

BakePanel.label: DecimationPanel.preset.quest.description
Bake: The recommended number of tris for Quest avatars.

BakePanel.label: Scene.decimation_animation_weighting.desc
Bake:
Weight decimation based on shape keys and vertex group overlap
Results in better animating topology by trading off overall shape accuracy
Use if your elbows/joints end up with bad topology

BakePanel.label: Scene.decimation_animation_weighting_factor.desc
Bake: How much influence the animation weighting has on the overall shape

BakePanel.label: Scene.tuxedo_max_tris.desc
Bake: The target amount of tris after decimation

BakePanel.label: Scene.max_tris.desc
Bake: The target amount of tris after decimation

BakePanel.label: GmodPanel.gmod_not_found
Bake: Your gmod install was not found! Check Warnings!

BakePanel.label: advanced_platform_options_desc
Bake: Advanced platform options like export formats and data generators like for physics models.

BakePanel.label: GmodPanel.panel_desc
Bake: The different options to use when compiling a Garry's Mod model.
